meanings.definition: relating to the study of the number, shape, and size of chromosomes
meanings.sent1: The karyological research focused on understanding the size of chromosomes in cells.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use karyological techniques to examine the shapes of chromosomes.
meanings.sent3: The karyological investigation into chromosome sizes revealed some surprising results.
meanings.sent4: Her karyological approach to solving the genetic puzzle was meticulous and detailed.
meanings.sent5: The karyological analysis of the chromosomes provided valuable insights into cell structure.

meanings.definition: pertaining to the branch of biology that deals with the study of the nucleus and its contents
meanings.sent1: The karyological study of the nucleus helped in understanding cell functions.
meanings.sent2: Biologists rely on karyological knowledge to explore the contents of the nucleus.
meanings.sent3: In a karyological mix-up, the scientist accidentally stained the wrong nucleus.
meanings.sent4: The karyological exploration of the nucleus revealed its intricate organization.
meanings.sent5: Through karyological investigations, scientists uncovered the secrets of the cell's nucleus.
